remarks: Given two atoms not under the fiducial co-atom ` W ` , there is a third.  Lemma B in [Crawley] p. 112.  TODO:  Is there a simpler more direct proof, that could be placed earlier e.g. near ~ lhpexle ?  Then replace ~ cdlemb2 with it.  This is a more general version of ~ cdlemb2 without ` P =/= Q ` condition.  (Contributed by NM, 27-Apr-2013.)
statement:
cdlemg5.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
cdlemg5.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
cdlemg5.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
cdlemg5.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
cdlemb3 $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ ( P e. A /\ -. P .<_ W ) /\ ( Q e. A /\ -. Q .<_ W ) ) -> E. r e. A ( -. r .<_ W /\ -. r .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ) ) $.
$d .<_ r $.
$d .\/ r $.
$d A r $.
$d H r $.
$d K r $.
$d P r $.
$d Q r $.
$d W r $.
